snippet.title: Six people injured as car ploughs into crowd in Los Angeles
snippet.content: At least six people were injured when a car drove into a crowd in Los Angeles. The vehicle careened into the crowd around 3.47pm Sunday local time (8.37am today AEST), on West Pico Boulevard in Wilshire, the . Two cars collided at an intersection after one of the vehicles ran a red light, Los Angeles police Sergeant Dwayne Wilson told the LA Times. The impact forced one car onto the sidewalk, where it hit a group of people dining alfresco at a restaurant. Four people have been rushed to hospital, while two other suffered non-life-threatening injuries. Both drivers remain at the scene. (C) Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
